column1: 147kph, full on off, hint of away swing, he drives with a push towards cover
140kph, full and much wider of off, not a big stride forward he just eases a square drive to point
play and miss. 144kph, good length outswinger, tempting him to drive and it just shapes past the edge with late swing.
138kph, back of a length, off stump line, he stands tall and defends on the back foot
137kph, good length, fifth stump line, he defends from the crease on the front foot to point

caught at third man! He fell for the trap! It was short and wide, he freed the hands to slap a cut shot up and over backward point, there was extra bounce, he got a top edge that flew all the way to third man and Zampa took the catch well, infront off his chest. What a start for Australia.
full and swinging well down the leg side and rightly called wide
139kph, half-volley on leg stump and he pings this away off his pads with ease! Lovely stroke. Right in Dhawan's zone. He loves these
140kph, full angled across him, he frees the arms and smokes a drive straight to the man at cover
140kph, good length, top of off, he defends with a dead bat on the front foot
good length, angled across the left-hander and he raises the bat to let it go
138kph, off cutter, good length, he plays from the crease pushing this towards point
140kph, full and shaping into the pads again and he eases this through the gap at wide mid on, nicely timed, didn't over hit it to pick up a couple
short and wide, seaming further away, Kohli isn't tempted to cut this, he watches it go by
141kph, he slices a drive off the outside half of the bat in the air for a short way but well wide of gully down to the wide third man
137kph, good length, it just holds in the surface a touch, he checks his drive pushing it back to the bowler
140kph, good length, off stump, he defends with the full face pushing to cover
shorter effort ball, he's jumping back and across to knock this down cautiously
back of a length, 139kph, he's up on his toes playing a back foot square drive but mistiming it to point
138kph, full and wide of off, hint of shapes, he gets a lovely stride in and drives in textbook fashion but straight to cover
glorious straight drive down the ground! Coulter-Nile over pitches, he just leans forward and punches this back past the stumps, straight of mid on. Supreme from King Kohli
full length again, he pushes forward and caresses it towards mid off, doesn't time this anywhere near as well
too straight and clipped through midwicket! Again he over pitched, angled in to off, he just uses the bottom hand to turn this through the gaping gap at midwicket and he timed it to perfection.
good length, fifth stump line, he's forward and defending with the head over the ball
full length, he just checks this stroke, turning the bottom hand to angle it to mid on
good length, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot
full length, he leans forward and pushes nicely but straight to cover
Cracking pull shot over square midwicket! It was banged in and he picked the length in a flash and smashed it flat through square midwicket! Shikhar is so quick on those.
very full outside off, he drives but gets it off the toe of the bat and it rolls slowly to cover
Superb back foot square drive! It was only fractionally short and wide, he got up on the toes, played with the vertical bat and placed it through backward point with outstanding timing.
good length, angled across him and he's happy to let this go through to the keeper
good length, fifth stump line, he defends on the front foot to point
fuller length, fifth stump line, he pushes with the full face to mid off
pushes a drive away from his body, slicing in the air well wide of gully to third man
flicked fine of fine leg! Bad ball this. Drifting down leg, fine leg is wide, he just helped it on it's way flicking it fine and it raced away.
good length, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot
good length, fourth stump line, he is forced to defend
it's down leg, he is back and tucking to short fine leg for a single
darted into off, not much turn, he's back and tapping this to the gap at point with the sweeper back in the deep
flatter into leg stump, he is back and working to square leg, some slight hesitation but an easy one
round arm, sliding in towards off, he's back and defending, Maxwell appealed for pad first but it looked all bat
fuller on off, he's forward and defending
sliding on with the arm into the pad, but it's going down leg and they bail out of the appeal
short drag down and he's back and pulling with control straight of deep midwicket and they get an easy two
full toss, he just pushes a drive to long off
shorter length, he's back and punching with the turn to deep midwicket
drifting to leg stump, he's back and clipping this neatly to deep midwicket
looped up on leg, he whips this firmly but straight to midwicket
tossed up outside leg, he watchfully tucks this around the corner to the man in the deep behind square
full outside off, he drives firmly straight to cover
round arm, flatter, sliding on, he's back and punching to cover-point

huge LBW appeal, given not out. The Australians think this is plumb. They review. Dhawan went back to a shorter ball but it slid on quickly off the pitch, he tried to pull and played straight over it. He was hit flush on the pad infront of leg. Ball tracking has it crashing into leg! He's OUT! That wasn't there to pull, not short enough and the low skid did him. Great review. Well bowled by Maxwell.
91kph, flatter, drifting across, he's forward and defending
shorter and flatter wide of off, he's back and cutting towards point but it's well fielded
tossed up, he reaches out and pushes this slowly to wide mid off and goes with the stroke pinching a single
good length fifth stump line, he defends on the front foot
back of a length, fifth stump line, he is squared up on the crease defending into the off side
140kph, good length, top of off, he is squared up and defending back to the bowler
beaten pushing away from his body at a 137kph, good length ball wide of off. A touch of extra bounce
143kph, back of a length, he's caught on the crease, he gets a thick inside edge onto pad
he charges down the track to a 135kph, length ball and tries to hit it out of Nagpur and gets a thick inside edge onto pad
darted into leg, full, he defends
looped up on leg, he whips this firmly off the front foot to deep midwicket
slower on leg, he's back and working to square leg, Handscomb dives and knocks it down but can't prevent the single
fuller on leg, he's forward and working this neatly to deep midwicket
shorter and slower, he's back and punching this to wide long on
144kph, fuller outside off, he pushes a drive to mid off
126kph, slower ball cutter outside off, he pushes on the front foot with an open face to gully
134kph, back of a length wide of off, he punches off the back foot but mistimes it due to the slow surface to point
short bouncer, way too high over the head of Rayudu and called wide
143kph, fuller length, fourth stump, he drives firmly back to the bowler
123kph, slower ball wide of off, he opens the face and delicately runs this to fine third man for a single
140kph, shorter length, he steps out and turns the wrists placing this to the gap at midwicket and immediately calls two, brilliant placement and running
flatter and shorter, he's back and tucking this to the circle at wide mid on and Maxwell sprints after it to ensure they don't look for two
tossed up on off, he skips down and defends, well bowled
slower on leg, length ball, he clips this straight to forward square
looped up on leg, slower, he pushes on the front foot to long on
tossed up outside off, he drives nicely past cover, wide of long off for a couple
flatter, round arm into middle, he clips this with the minimal turn to deep midwicket
quicker leg break, 91kph, he's back and defending infront of the stumps
good length, he is back trying to pull, it skids on, he gets a bottom edge onto pad!
shorter length, he's back giving room and punching to cover
tossed up on off, he is forward and smothering the spin
leg break looped up outside off, he strides out and drives firmly to deep cover-point
quicker and flatter, into the wicket, he's back and mistiming a punch to long on
shorter on leg, he's back and punching firmly to wide long on
full and drifting wide of off, he frees the hands and plays a flowing cover drive through the ring and there's no one defending on the rope at deep point! Good shot. Too wide from Maxwell
tossed up on leg, he gets a leading edge closing the edge early, but it rolls safely to cover
shorter length, he's back and working it to forward square
shorter and slower, he's back and cracking this firmly to the man at wide long on
shorter length but not that short, just outside off, he's back and pulling, mistiming it to deep square leg
leg break, tossed up, he steps forward and drives neatly to long off
fuller on off, he mistimes a drive back to the bowler and Zampa dives to his right to stop it
waist high full toss and he latches on smashing over midwicket! Just a loose delivery, but he didn't quite middle it to get six. But four nonetheless
fuller, drifting down leg, it just brushes the pad and rolls fine for a leg bye
good length leg break, he sits back and dabs it to backward point, he looks for one but it's not on and Rayudu sends him back
full outside off, he drives nicely, inside out to deep cover-point
shorter drifting into the pads, he tries to pull, it comes off pad and runs fine for a couple of leg byes
looped up outside off, he reaches out and whips with the turn to midwicket
flatter and quicker wide of off, he sits back and plays a delightful late dab, opening the face running it fine for four! Brilliant. He wants to put Lyon under pressure
flatter and fuller length, he's back and forced to defend
the 'other one', Lyon calls it 'Jeff', like a carrom ball, he's back and punching to long on

He's given LBW! Rayudu reviews. It was shorter, pitching close to leg, he went back and wiped across the line with an open face as it came off the surface slowly, trying to strangely slice it into the off side. He missed it and was hit on the back pad. Did it pitch in line? No bat involved. Ball tracking says pitching in line, hitting middle! Plumb. India lose Rayudu and the review!
tossed up outside off, big stride out to drive to sweeper cover
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
very full on off stump, making sure he denies the batsman any elevation. Driven firmly back to the bowler
flat length ball - on the fuller side again - on middle and off, skids on with the angle. Defended back to the bowler
drags it filthily short on this occasion - was he trying to bowl the flipper? It just seemed to stick in his hand too long. Kohli opens up and puts it away to the square leg boundary
overpitched now, and lots of width. Kohli drives and easily beats the sweeper on the cover point boundary, finds the gap to his right
flighted ball on middle and leg, gets on the front foot and clips to the right of long-on
lovely flight on an off-stump line. Kohli stretches out but can't get close enough to the pitch of it to drive. Only manages a defensive push to extra-cover
the line is now more middle-stumpish and Kohli can bring his wrists into play to flick to the right of midwicket
tossed up on leg stump, takes a step out of his crease and drives to long-on
tossed up on off stump, whipped to deep square leg
flatter now, length ball on off stump, nice use of the wrists to clip that to the left of short fine leg
full-toss on middle stump, clipped far enough to the right of long-on to pick up a comfortable two
another full-toss, on off stump. Now he shows the full face and punches firmly to long-on
nicely flighted, pitching on off and spinning away. Good stride from Kohli as always, drives with a straight bat to sweeper cover
he's struggling with his release today. Another full-toss, about three-fourths of a stump high. Punched to long-off

ooh, keeps a little low. Nice length outside off, brings Kohli forward but he isn't near enough the pitch to close down the turn. Spins past the edge as he looks to steer it behind point, and keeps a little low to flummox the keeper
full on off stump, clipped away to deep midwicket
shot. It's a touch short, and quite a bit of width on it. Vijay punches it crisply, with a straight bat, to the point boundary
back of a length close to off stump, gets behind it, drops it gently into the off side with soft hands, and immediately calls Kohli through for a sneaky single
full, angling into middle stump. Kohli gets across and flicks it to fine leg
back of a length, a bit of nip back in towards off stump. Cramps Vijay as he looks to dab into the point region, and he inside edges into his thigh pad
back of a length, a little wider outside off. Presses forward and defends to backward point

back of a length just outside off. Vijay takes a step back and across to try and flick it to the right of midwicket, but he doesn't get close enough to the line to be able to find the gap. Hits it to the fielder instead
flat trajectory, angling across to off stump. Goes back and across and clips to midwicket
nicely bowled, drifts it across to off stump and Kohli stretches out, looking to defend, playing for turn. Slides on with the angle to beat the outside edge
a bit more flight and Kohli can take a big step forward to whip it firmly to long-on
flat length ball slanting across the batsman. Good stride forward to defend
length ball, angles across a little further. Presses forward and dabs to backward point with an open face
nicely bowled again. Flat and quick, angling across to just outside off stump. Looks for the clipped single to long-on but Lyon dives quickly to his right to cut it off
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and guides it to third man
fuller now, fourth-stump line. Gets forward for the checked drive to mid-off

nice length, on the fuller side of a good length without being full enough to play the full-blooded drive. Gets forward to try and drive past extra-cover but the fielder dives to his right to parry the ball away
shortish on off stump, gets on his toes to ride the bounce and punch into the point region
length ball, angling into middle and leg. Tucked away quietly to long leg
fullish, close to off stump, looks like the offcutter. Shows the full face to punch it back to the bowler
quickish on the pads. Tickled away into the fine fine leg region
flat again, a touch shorter on leg stump, and that's cleverly done. Steps across his stumps to create the opportunity to glance it really fine, and he leaves long leg no chance
flat length ball on leg stump, clipped to deep midwicket
back of a length, straightens slightly onto an off-stump line. Goes deep in his crease and punches to long-on
nicely flighted close to off stump, good stretch out to get close to the pitch and defend
length ball on off stump, gets forward and clips to the right of midwicket
overpitched, angling into off stump, and that's a super shot from Vijay. Gets forward and brings his bottom hand into play to drive it between the non-striker and mid-on
short, fifth-stump line, lets it come on and steers it to third man
fullish, close to off stump, strides forward and pushes to deep point to bring up his 50th fifty in ODIs. Wow.
back of a length, angling slightly down leg, tucked off the hip towards long leg. Not sure he got any bat on it, actually
back of a length close to  off stump, lets it come on and chops it to third man
fullish, angling into off stump, nice use of the wrists again to clip into the gap to the right of mid-on, forces the fielder into a sprint and a dive
nice trajectory, dips onto a good length close to off stump, all the while angling across Vijay. Gets on the front foot to defend with soft hands
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away to long leg
back of a length on off stump, goes back and across for the straight-bat punch to deep square leg
flat, angled across onto a good length outside off. Stretches forward and across to defend
fuller now, on off stump, whipped to midwicket
nicely played. Again that length where he can't drive firmly along the ground, angled across him to off stump. Uses his wrists to chip it deliberately over the wide mid-on region
back of a length on off stump, pulled round whippily to deep square leg
looks to step out and Coulter-Nile sees him coming. Shortens his length and bowls wider outside off. Pulled to midwicket
back of a length close to off stump, waits on it and steers it down to third man
shot! This has been such a confident, accomplished knock so far. Short outside off, and that's more a straight-bat punch than a front-foot pull, up and over midwicket
angles this slightly down leg, and Vijay misses the flick. Rolls off the pad and beats the keeper diving to his left. Carey gets one glove on it to keep the runs down
and again, that almost-straight-bat punch over midwicket. This one was even shorter, and he can free his arms even more to clear the boundary
back of a length, close to off stump, and that's smartly done. Stays leg-side of the ball, waits, and uses the pace and round-the-wicket angle to guide it into the gap to the left of short third man
tossed up wide of off stump, and Kohli brings his wrists into play to whip it to long-on
well played. Goes on the back foot to one that keeps a little low and slides on towards off stump. Does well to play with a perfectly straight bat and keep it out, punches it back to the bowler
on the pads, clipped firmly but straight to backward square leg
a little shorter, goes back and works it to deep square leg
tossed up on middle stump, gets forward for the flick to backward square leg

that's some greeting. Flights it and drops it into his hitting arc, on off stump, but he still had to do the bulk of the work there, nice stride forward, keeping his front leg out of the way, and drives it firm and crisp, back over the bowler's head
looks for another big hit, this time he isn't quite close enough to the pitch of the ball. Skews it briefly in the air, towards long-off
back of a length close to off stump, goes back to chop to short third man
flights it now, outside off, and overpitches. Kohli puts it away easily, drives with the follow-through over his left shoulder, and finds the wide long-off boundary

oh no. That's such an unfortunate way to go. Full again, and Kohli drives it straight this time, with a lot of power, and the bowler dives to his right and gets his fingertips onto the ball, just about grazes it on its way to the stumps at the other end. Vijay dives to try and regain his ground, but he's just short. A really unfortunate end to a superb innings, he deserved at least a fifty here
flat length ball on off stump, Kohli stretches out to block into the covers
back of a length, angling across to top of off. Goes deep in his crease to tuck it away through backward square leg
flat length ball on leg stump, clipped to the right of backward square leg
tossed up slow outside off, presses forward, waits, and blocks it back to the bowler
a touch short, turning in towards off stump, rocks back, makes room, and cuts it away a long way to the left of Handscomb at deep cover point. Good effort in the deep to keep it down to three
flat length ball, bounces extra to hit Kohli on the glove as he leans back for the late cut
a touch short, Kohli pulls but can't beat the man at backward square leg
flat length ball, straightens along an off-stump line, goes back to defend into the covers
full on off stump, punched to long-off, briefly in the air
loopy delivery just outside off. Another full-blooded straight drive from Kohli, back towards the bowler on this occasion
flat, back of a length, skids on towards leg stump. Goes back to flat-bat to long-on
length ball on leg stump, clipped away towards deep square leg
short on off stump, makes a bit of room to punch it away to the right of Stoinis at sweeper cover
flat length ball angling across to off stump, goes back to defend with soft hands
back of a length on leg stump, clipped to backward square leg
flat length ball on middle stump, clipped to midwicket

well bowled. Length ball pitching on leg stump, goes with the angle towards off stump. Almost closes his face playing for turn, but watches it well and adjusts to show a fullish face and play into the covers
back of a length on off stump, hangs back and chops to short third man
flat length ball on middle and off, punched back to the bowler
nutmegged. Tossed up wide of off and Jadhav stretches out for the sweep. The ball keeps low, and he ends up bottom-edging it between the keeper's legs
gone, that's a soft dismissal. Full and wide outside off, perhaps too full to play the lofted drive over short extra-cover. Goes for it and hits it straight to the fielder

and he's gone first ball! Perhaps not short enough to cut, or wide enough, and it hurries through off the pitch. Dhoni rocks back and only manages a thick edge that is gobbled up brilliantly at slip by Usman Khawaja falling to his right. He wouldn't have had much reaction time there
shorter length leg break, he's back and tucking this behind square to the fielder
edged and just short of slip! Brilliant wrong un, he pressed forward and got an edge but the soft hands and angled bat saw it fall just short of Khawaja!
flatter and quicker outside off, he lets this go
full outside off, he flicks this through square leg with superb wrists and they sprint for two and get it
shorter length on leg, he's back and tucking this behind square for one this time
tossed up outside off, he reaches forward and smothers the spin

is he stumped? This is sent upstairs to the TV umpire. 87kph beautifully flighted off break, it drops and spins past the edge as he stretches a long way forward to defend, his back foot dragged out but he just gets his toe back! Not out. It was close
shorter length, wide of off, he dabs a cut behind point to rotate the strike
shorter on leg, he's back deep in the crease and glancing it fine but just for one
tossed up outside off, he reaches out and slaps a drive with the bottom hand to long on
drifting into off, he pushes on the front foot to cover
loopy full toss, gently pushed down the ground to long on
full outside off, he drives hard to cover's right and Finch gets a touch on it but can't knock it down, but they only get two. He might have stopped the boundary
fuller on leg, he turns this straight to forward square leg in the circle
tossed up on middle, he drills this down to long on
tossed up on middle, he just pushes this angling it to midwicket
flatter and quicker wide of off, he's back and cutting hard to deep cover-point
tossed up on middle, he stretches forward and defends with soft hands
drifting into leg stump, he turns this around the corner against the spin but straight to the man at square leg
looped up outside off, he defends again reaching out
tossed up, he pushes this slowly in the air for a little bit towards wide long on, Kohli calls two straight away and runs brilliantly to get back easily
full down the leg side and called wide
darted into leg stump, he's back and clipping this to forward square
flatter on middle, he pushes this gently to the gap at midwicket for a single
tossed high outside off, he lets this go
looped up wide of off, he punches a drive to deep cover-point
flatter on middle and off, he's back and tucking this to midwicket but the fielder is there
pushed down the leg side and Kohli lets it go for a wide
tossed up, he whips this powerfully along the ground with the bottom into the gap at wide long on and Handscomb slides on the rope to make the save
short ball, 129kph, on off, he stands up on his toes and defends dropping it to his feet
139kph, good length, hurries him, he jams it off the inside edge onto pad and it drops behind square and they pinch one
short and wide and he slashes this up and over backward point! Too wide and he hammered it wide of third man with those trademark fast hands
shorter slower ball outside off, he's up on his toes angling the blade and running it towards third man to rotate the strike
good length, top of off, 144kph, he defends on the front foot
good length, top of off, he pushes opening the face towards backward point
tossed up on leg, he strides forward to clip this to wide long on
round arm, shorter, he's back and creating room to cut hard to deep point
looped higher and slower, he waits and drives down to long on
drifting into middle, he pushes firmly to long on
flatter and shorter on leg, he's back and tucking this behind square for a single
this kept low. It was shorter, he went back to cut, it slid through and he jammed the bat down to keep it out
fuller, 142kph, angled into middle, he clips this uppishly towards midwicket but well short the man in the circle

Kohli nearly run out by Maxwell! Slower ball he dabs it to backward point, Kohli runs, Jaddu sends him back, Maxwell swoops to his right, gathers and fires and misses! He was out by miles, they get an over throw in the end! Huge reprieve
length outside off, he dabs this down to third man
good length outside off, Kohli pushes towards gully and Maxwell is hunting, no attempt to run this time
141kph, back of a length wide of off, he's back and running this off the open face to third man
142kph, back of a length outside off, he's up on his toes defending this to gully
fuller on leg, he clips this firmly to deep midwicket
shorter and flatter, 90kph, he's back and slapping this to long on
quicker wide of off, he's back and dabbing to backward point
fuller and he drives extravagantly to long on
shorter length, he's back and running this off the face to short third man and they pinch one
91kph, full on leg, he turns this off this pads with ease through square leg to the sweeper
short ball outside off, he swivels and cracks a pull shot along the ground straight to midwicket
good length, top of middle, he is caught on the crease defending
length ball, he charges and stays leg side to run this to third man
he walks down the track, stands tall and knocks this down towards midwicket for a single
shorter length, 133kph, he pulls firmly to deep square leg

shorter slower ball wide of off, he gets on top of the bounce and punches this wide of cover with great timing given how slow it bounced, Handscomb has a long chase from deep point and just reels it in
flatter and slid through, he dabs this fine of short third man
pushed through flatter wide of off, he tries to cut but misses
round arm, slung into leg stump, it comes of pad and runs fine of short fine for a leg bye
short ball, surprised him, he stands up and bunts it to deep midwicket
tossed up high, on middle, he leans forward and pushes it slowly into the leg side for a single
fuller on leg stump, he clips this firmly to deep forward square but only one
short and wide and slashed through point! Century number 40 in ODI cricket for Virat Kohli! Too short and too wide and crunched to the backward point boundary.
shorter ball that bounces higher, he plays a tennis type smash to knock it back to the bowler
slower ball, outside off, he defends to cover-point and they take a tight one
slower ball outside off, he sits back and runs this down to third man for a single
short ball, cracks a pull shot hard to deep square but straight to the sweeper
good length, top of off, he's forced to defend from the crease
flatter into leg stump, he knocks this to deep midwicket

was this dropped by Stoinis at deep midwicket? Yes it was! It was pulled flat to the deep, Stoinis was there, sliding on his knees and put it down! They get two. He got both hands to it. Maybe didn't quite move quick enough early enough.
fuller leg break, he defends this with the spin into the leg side
shorter and he's back and pushing this to the gap at cover
leg break on leg stump, he tucks this straight to square leg
wrong un outside leg, he tries to sweep but is hit on the pad
shorter length, top of off, he gets up on his toes and knocks this down into the gully
slower ball on leg, he tucks this to the circle at square leg and they sprint immediately for two and get there despite Marsh's throw coming in quickly
back of a length, he's giving room and late cutting to deep wide third man
good length, top of off, he's turning this with the bottom hand wide of mid on

caught at mid off! Slower ball does the trick. Mid off was inside the circle. It was full, he gave himself some room to go inside out over mid off, he miscues off the toe of the bat and slices it high to mid off, Khawaja runs back from the circle and takes the catch well.
shorter length wide of off, he stands up and cracks a cut shot off the front foot forward of point but he hit it too well and only gets one as it reaches the sweeper quickly
good length leg break, he's back and punching back to the bowler
tossed up and he whips against the spin wide of long on and beats the man! Staggering timing and placement to beat the sweepers on the rope!
shorter length, he's back and whipping this to deep midwicket but only one this time
full outside leg, he sweeps with control to deep fine leg to rotate the strike
looped up leg break, he drives gloriously through cover but there is a man well placed for that shot in the deep
full outside off, he sweeps hard forward of square, Kohli yells 'Two!' and they get back easily to Kohli can take the strike next over

caught at deep square leg! Kohli can't believe he found the fielder! He's furious with himself. Short slower ball stopped in the surface a touch, he timed the pull shot well but just dragged it squarer than he intended, straight to Stoinis who holds on! The end of another masterful display.
good length, top of off, he's back and across and defending
an edge but it just falls short of Carey! It was wide, he tried to late cut and got a thin edge but the slowness of the pitch saw it not carry
good length, angled into the pads, he gets a thin inside edge, onto pad and rolls away for a single

Bowled him around his legs! Slower ball off cutter, it pitched outside leg, Kuldeep shuffled across his stumps trying to glance it fine, he missed and it crashed into the exposed leg stump! Four for Cummins!
good length, top of off, Bumrah plays a rock solid forward defence to a huge roar from the crowd
shorter ball, he backs away and pulls firmly to deep midwicket
chopped on! This was full and wide of off, he reached away from his body to drive, got a thick inside edge and dragged it back onto the stumps! India bowled out with 10 balls left!
135kph, swinging way down the leg side, miles down and called wide
shorter into the hip, 141kph, he's back and tucking this off the hip down to fine leg to get underway
full on the pads, 135kph, he glances this easily off the pads wide of fine leg and they get an easy two
137kph, good length, nips across the left-hander, he drops the bat and hands inside the line to let it go through to Dhoni
139kph, shorter length, steep bounce, he's back and knocking this down with control, well played
good length, angled across the left-hander, 139kph, he's letting this go
clipped very fine for four! This was too straight, swinging down leg, he shuffled back and across and tickles it fine. Nicely done for the first boundary of the chase
outswinger, swinging far too wide outside the guidelines and called
beaten fending at a sharp outswinger that leaps away from back of a length but it was well wide. He didn't need to play
short and wide, he tried to cut but could not reach it was so wide
good length, outswinger, 135kph, he's happy to leave this alone wide of off
play and miss driving at a good length ball leaving him off the seam way wide of off. Again feeling for the ball well wide
there was the inswinger and he spots it, clipping it nicely from off stump with the angle pinging it through midwicket, Jadhav has a long chase and slides to haul it in
full swinging away, he's caught on the crease, squared up, defending towards point
good length, angled across him and he's happy to leave this alone wide of off
142kph, good length, fourth stump line, he's back and across and defending firmly to cover
140kph, swinging well down the leg side. There's some swing there for Shami and Bumrah
he's away with a glorious drive on the up through cover! Will that break the shackles? It wasn't a half-volley but he got a trademark big stride and drives inside out past cover and away for four!
beaten again, fending away from his body. It was back of a length and shaping wider of off
good length, fifth stump line, shaping away, he's back and across and punching to cover
good length but too straight, on leg, he's back and clipping this behind square neatly for a couple
140kph, good length, well wide of off, shaping away, he is happy to leave
what a delivery! Angled in, shaping away sharply, he waves at it with no footwork and misses
beaten again, squared up and it stayed low. Good length, 140kph, he's back and it shoots low and nips away
shorter length, he plays an pull shot, flicking fine to long leg to rotate the strike
play and miss fending again! It was back of a length, it didn't shape at all, held it's line, he fended off the back foot and misses
good length, angled into the top of off, he's half-forward defending on the front foot

edged for four! Some fortune now for Finch! Good length outside off, he drives hard on the up, gets a thick edge and it flies well wide of Sharma at slip, through where second or third might have stood and it runs fine of third man
back of a length, nipping away, he opens the face and glides it with control to third man
142kph, back of a length, fourth stump line, he's back and across and defending with a broad bat to cover
shorter length, he's back and working this to square leg
shorter length outside off, he's up on his toes and punching firmly and nicely but straight to cover
139kph, pushed well down the leg side and called wide
140kph fuller outside off, he drives but his weight is back a touch, and he mistimes to mid off
good length, angled into off, he's half forward, just getting the bat down in front of pad and pushing it to mid on
shorter length on off, he's back and across and clipping this wristily to forward square
too short and he pulls this with ease up and over square leg! He's so quick to seize the length and just help it on it's way in languid style!
beaten all ends up by 118kph slower ball! Just missed off stump! Wow. He was completely deceived by the dipping off spinning slower ball
he walks at Bumrah, it's fired into the pads and it rolls off the pad fine, Dhoni knocks it down with the right hand but they get a leg bye
another waft and miss. Good length well wide of off, he's caught on the crease and he just waved at it without moving his feet
good length, angled into the top of off, 139kph, he is defending decisively from the crease
good length, turning in from outside off, he just gets into line and knocks it with the turn to the gap at square leg
shorter length, he's punching from the crease to cover-point
beaten by a ripping delivery that spins sharply away! He was back and trying to punch again square but it ragged away
shorter length, no turn this time, he's back and defending
tossed up, on middle, he defends on the front foot
pushed through flatter and quicker, he's back and defending
half-volley on the pads and he sweetly times this but picks out square leg. A couple of metres either side and it was four
slower ball angled down leg, he flicks this wide of fine leg with supreme timing! He just turned the wrists and it raced away to the rope wide of fine leg. Too straight from Bumrah
fuller length outside off, he mistimes a drive back to the bowler
big flash and miss driving on the up outside off. It was nowhere near full enough but he swung hard at the width offered and it shaped past the edge
fuller on middle, he clips this firmly wide of mid on and runs with the stroke but Rayudu makes a good stop on the circle to prevent more runs
140kph, good length, angled in, he presses forward and defends to cover
short drag down wide of off, he's back and cracking a cut straight to the man at point
tossed up and he slog sweeps with the spin over square leg! Safe shot. No one back, just picked it up with the turn and deposited it over the leg side.
tossed up on leg, he clips this neatly to wide long on for one
darted in full, he presses forward and defends back to the bowler
drifting down leg, he glances this fine and it races away! Drifting too far and Finch does well to tickle it fine for four
fuller outside off, he drives to cover but can't beat the man
short on the hip and he's back and flicking this away with ease behind square and finds the rope! Too easy.
full and wide of off, he plays a nice square drive out to deep point
full toss and thumped down the ground! He climbed into this smoking it back past the bowler straight of mid off! He stood and admired that shot
cutter outside off, he chops this towards the wide gully but can't beat the man
an educated edge fine of short third man! Good length, fourth stump line, he opened the face to run it fine but got it finer than planned! But the result was what he was after as it raced away
shorter length, outside off, he stands up and punches back to the bowler
shorter outside off, he's back and forcing this to the gap at point
tossed up outside off, he pushes firmly on the front foot to cover
looped up outside off, he drives firmly past cover to wide long off
opens the face and runs it fine of short third man! What a shot. It was tossed up outside off, he pressed forward to defend but angled the blade and ran it fine
tossed up on off, he tucks it to midwicket
fired quickly down the leg side and called wide
slightly shorter, he's back and working this from off stump through square leg between the two sweepers in the deep, they call two straight away and get it
this is down leg and spinning down further and called wide
slog sweep over midwicket into the crowd! This is Aaron Finch at his best! Into the arc, he's down on one knee and smashing this 83m with the spin over midwicket and way back!
looped up outside off, he steps forward and defends
beaten by the wrong un. Did him cold. Well bowled. He played for the stock ball and it spun sharply past the edge
LBW appeal but not out. He tried to sweep and got in a tangle but got hit outside the line of off
dances down but doesn't pick the wrong un until late, he thrusts the pad at it to knock it down
he goes deep in the crease, playing with the spin tucking it to midwicket
low side arm, straight on, pitching on middle, he defends on the front foot
another low arm ball, he's back and tucking it square on the leg side
tossed up outside leg, he turns this straight to square leg again
low side arm outside off, he's back and punching to cover
shorter and wider, he's back and punching hard but can't beat cover
round arm but fuller, he drives firmly to long off
tossed up outside off, he drives easily inside out to deep cover-point
straighter line, he flicks it with the spin off the front foot to deep square
drifting into leg stump, he drives with the full face to long on
full outside off, he works it with the bottom hand to long on
darted into middle stump, he defends on the front foot
shorter length outside off, he's back and forcing straight to cover
tossed up very full and he defends on the front foot smothering the spin
slightly shorter and wider, he gets back and chops a cut into the gap, there's an appeal for LBW as it hit the back pad first but it was miles outside the line

LBW! He's out sweeping! Finch asks Khawaja about a review but decides against. It was tossed up on off, he gets down on one knee to sweep square, misses, gets hit on the front pad in front of off stump as it's spinning back down the line and the umpire's finger goes up!
looped up outside off, he steps out and defends smothering the spin
tossed up on middle, he gets forward and defends on the front foot
short and wide, he's back and mistiming a cut shot to cover
tossed up, he drives to cover
round arm, shorter, outside off, he tries to late cut and chops it down

caught at cover off the leading edge! What a mistake! This was looped up on off, Khawaja lazily gets forward and closes the bat face early trying to work against the minimal spin, gets a thick leading edge that flies in the air all the way to cover and Kohli takes the simple catch!
tossed very high outside off, he waits and drives nicely to long off
darted in outside off, he gets forward and opens the blade to run it through backward point, using the pace and placing it nicely in the gap for two
round arm, slung into off stump, he's forward and defending
full toss, it drops on him, he reaches out and chips it towards long on, very safely and in control
tossed up on middle and leg, spinning away, he's half forward and defending
an edge as it spins a touch but he has soft hands and it runs past slip along the ground, they get two
shorter length, he's back and punching square to deep point
shorter length, he's back and giving room, he's hurried but able to force it down to long off
shorter on leg stump, he's back and whipping this through square leg to the sweeper in the deep
drifting in to off stump, he steps forward and defends
shorter length, he's back and punching firmly down to long on
very round arm, he clips it with the spin from middle stump but can't beat the man at midwicket
round arm, almost underground, he's back and punching it in the air flat towards long off but it lands well inside the circle and safely
shorter on leg, he's back and forcing down to long on
slower and drifting away wide of off, he sits back and waits for an eternity to cut it fine past backward point for a couple
tossed up slow just outside off. Marsh props forward and realises he's not really close to the pitch of it. Adjusts nicely with his hands to push into the cover point region
flatter, stays back to try and cut, maybe. Has to adjust since this turns in sharply towards leg stump and cramps him for room. Punches into the covers instead
down the track now, clips this middle-stump ball with the turn to the right of midwicket
quicker, stays back to a length ball and punches to short extra-cover
short, a bit of width, slapped to the sweeper at deep cover point
tossed up wide of off stump, drags a bottom-handed swipe out to long-on for one
on the pads, clipped off the front foot through backward square leg
round-arm and fairly full outside off, pushed gently to deep point with an open face
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
tossed up fairly wide of off, driven firmly but can't beat the man at extra-cover
tossed up slow just outside off, lets it come on and dabs to the left of Kuldeep at backward point
dangled up slow, gets a tiny bit of drift away from off stump. Handscomb presses forward, lets the ball drop, and drives to long-off
back of a length close to off stump, stabbed to backward point
fuller now, driven towards mid-off and short extra-cover sprints to his right to intercept. Replays suggest it was the knuckle-ball
shortish outside off, punched to deep point
fullish, slanting across to off stump and then it holds up on the pitch a little as Marsh comes forward to drive. Looks like the offcutter. Waits and eases it with an open face to deep point

in the blockhole on off stump, looks like there's a bit of late tail in as well. Handscomb just shows it the full face and punches firmly past the right hand of Shami, tumbling in his follow-through to try and stop it
length ball, fourth-stump line, lets it come on and steers to third man
flat, angling into off stump, goes back and defends into the covers
fuller now, on off stump, gets forward to clip to long-on
full, a bit of flight outside off. Clipped with a strong bottom hand to long-on
full on off stump, driven to the right of extra-cover, where Kohli makes a diving stop but lets the ball slip out of his grasp
flat length ball just outside off, goes back and across to block it back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, gets nicely behind the line to punch to long-on
slower one, fairly full on leg stump. Closes his bat face early while looking to flick, and sends a leading edge running away through point. Seemed to grip the surface and turn like an offbreak too
back of a length on off stump, defended towards mid-on
ooh, good ball. Hits the seam on a good length in the corridor, and gets the ball to bounce a little extra. Beats Handscomb's attempted angled-bat drive
length ball, fourth-stump line, Handscomb plays a checked drive to deep point
slower offcutter on the pads, nurdled away into the backward square leg region. No bat on it, umpire Dharmasena suggests - must have just gone off the pad
length ball angling into off stump, stays slightly leg-side of the ball to push to the left of extra-cover

beauty. Dangled up slow outside off and it dips to make Handscomb reach out in front of his body to defend. Then it rips past his outside edge - massive turn out of nowhere. Dhoni whips off the bails and appeals to the square-leg umpire, but I think his back foot is firmly planted behind the crease. They check with the third umpire, and it is
full on off stump, gets on the front foot to clip to long-on
full, pitches on off stump and spins past the inside edge of the attempted flick. Not much of an appeal, it looked to be going down leg
fullish outside off, defended into the covers

huge appeal, and it's given! Sharp turn once again, from just outside off, and Marsh goes on the back foot to flick. Spins too much for him to middle it, and Dhoni does spectacularly to catch it down the leg side after the ball grazes his inside edge
tossed up full on off stump, driven to long-off
back of a length outside off, punched to the right of deep point
back of a length offcutter, spins past the front pad and down the leg side as Handscomb sits back to try and flick
fullish outside off, gets forward to ease a drive into the cover point region

length ball outside off, Maxwell plays a sliced drive to backward point - I love the way he uses his hands to manipulate where this particular shot goes, but on this occasion he only finds the fielder
back of a length close to off stump, shuffles across and punches firmly back to the bowler
slower yorker, dips down late past Maxwell's attempt at jabbing down on the ball, beats his inside edge, and only just misses off stump.
shortish now, in the corridor. Maxwell gets on his toes to punch towards cover
flat length ball slides on with the angle, towards leg stump. Handscomb goes back to try and punch square. Cramped for room, he punches straight to extra cover
stays back again, jabs this out to backward point
a little slower, on off stump, stays back to open his bat face and steer to deep point
fullish on middle and leg, defended back down the pitch
ooh, well bowled. Comes forward and looks to drive to long-off. Ball doesn't pitch as full as he thinks, and goes on with the arm. Plays it back to the bowler off the inner half of the bat
a touch short, goes back to cut but the ball holds up off the surface and he has to adjust, wait, and stab to backward point

massive turn. Goes back to a length ball, looking to work it with the spin. There's way more turn than he expects, though, pitches on off stump, raises a cloud of dust, and smacks him on the thigh pad
tossed up slower, stretches out to paddle it gently into the fine leg region
tossed up on off stump, swept once more to fine leg
nicely flighted, dips onto a good length on off stump. Maxwell waits, reads the wrong'un off the pitch, and pushes to extra-cover

another wrong'un, and Kuldeep beats Maxwell and causes him to overbalance. MS Dhoni appeals for a stumping... Nah. He lifted his back foot momentarily but he jammed it back down quickly. Lovely delivery, floated this wider than the previous one and Maxwell reached out for it, unsure which way it was turning
fuller now, on middle stump, clipped down to long-on
length ball angling into off stump, clipped into the leg side and midwicket dives right to stop it
well bowled. Length ball straightening slightly after angling in towards off stump. Stays back and gets opened up slightly while punching into the covers
back of a length, angling in towards off stump. Gets on the back foot to push towards mid-on, who's deep enough to allow a scampered single
back of a length, angling in towards middle stump. Stays leg-side of the ball to try and manufacture a single into the off side, but extra-cover moves quickly to his left to cut it off
full, close to off stump, gets on the front foot and drives straight to cover point
back of a length, angling into the top of middle stump. Clipped watchfully to midwicket
tossed up outside off, gets a good stride forward to drive but can't beat extra-cover
back of a length outside off, punches it away but without too much power, and backward point moves a few steps to his right to stop it

a string of dots, Maxwell looks to force it, and Kuldeep gets a bit of inconsistent bounce off the surface to get his man. Shortish, maybe not short enough to pull, and he exposes his stumps as he opens up to do so. Keeps really low and sneaks under his bat to crash into middle stump. India have slowly built some pressure over the last few overs, and the wickets have duly followed. Big, big moment.
back of a length, pitching just outside off. Worked with the turn through square leg
tossed up slow outside off, stretches out to paddle it fine
back of a length, wrong'un, turns from leg to off. Stays back and whips to deep square leg
back of a length, angling in towards off stump. Gets half forward to defend into the covers
back of a length, angling in towards top of off. Blocked back to the bowler
back of a length close to off stump, gets back and across to defend into the off side
length ball on off stump, and Vijay does very well to dive to his left and stop the ball at mid-off. A crisply timed drive, amounts to nothing
fullish slower ball outside off, gets half-forward again and defends gently towards short midwicket, lets the ball hit his bat
back of a length close to off stump, stays leg-side of the ball and jabs it into the point region

beauty. Tossed up invitingly outside off, Stoinis barely gets a stride in to defend and ends up pushing at the ball, a long way in front of his body. Creates a big gap for the ball to spin through, and only the extra bounce saves him
fuller now, clipped gently into the on side
tossed up slow outside off, reaches out again for a tentative push back to the bowler
length ball spinning in towards off stump. Presses forward to defend into the on side

and he's immediately in action, Kohli the fielder, throws himself to his left after Stoinis presses forward and finds himself nowhere near the pitch of a big-spinning, bouncing stock ball, bat and pad close together. Pops off the outside of his pad, doesn't look like an inside edge, and Kohli can't quite reach it anyway
fuller now, driven to sweeper cover
fired in flat on middle stump, presses forward and blocks into the on side
a little slower, this length ball outside off. Turns away after stopping on the track. Stoinis opens his bat face to ease it behind backward point
flat length ball straightening towards off stump. Good use of the bottom hand to shovel this standing sweep towards fine leg
flat length ball on off stump, stays on the back foot and punches to short extra-cover
again, stays back to a length ball and punches it to short extra-cover
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, goes back and flat-bats to long-off
floated up slow on off stump, driven to long-off
back of a length outside off, hardly any bounce. Makes a bit of room and punches towards extra-cover, where Dhyawan makes a driving stop
back of a length again, punched to extra-cover
tossed up extremely slow, angling down leg. Paddled away nice and fine to pick up a couple

ooh, Dhoni nearly manufactures a wicket out of nowhere! Again it's slow, again the line is leg-stumpish, and again Handscomb looks to paddle. Off the glove, and Dhoni started moving to the leg side as soon as he began shaping for that shot. He's in position, but he's unsighted and has to react with pure instinct, and the ball pops out of his gloves. Excellent anticipation there
wider outside off this time, and the ball keeps low to sneak under the attempted sweep
flat, angling into the pads, nurdled gently into the square leg region
flat, angling towards leg stump, and Handscomb sweeps it away firm and hard to the backward square leg boundary
full on off stump, driven to long-on
full on leg stump, moves his feet away from the line to drive to long-off
flat and full, angling into off stump, clipped to midwicket
flat length ball sliding on towards off stump, cramps him for room and he blocks to midwicket
steps out but with Jadhav bowling so slow - and slinging it through so low - Stoinis can only knock it back where it came from
good length ball outside off, beats his back-foot push as it curves away in the air
keeps so low and Stoinis is just about able to whip it to midwicket. Jadhav's line - always attacking the stumps - is so dangerous on slow, unevenly bouncing pitch
tries to work it away to fine leg but misses making contact
short and wide, but even then, the lack of pace off the pitch means his cut shot only finds cover
turns it towards square leg, searching for a single, but it's not there. Only the wide off that very quick over
stays back to a good length ball, backing his skills with the cut shot, but even still he only escapes chopping on.
goes for the sweep the moment Jadeja's line is on the stumps, wanders off the pad behind square leg
steps out to turn a full delivery on the stumps into a full toss and thumps it down to long-on
premeditates the sweep and that allows Jadeja to hang the ball outside the off stump, looking to beat the batsman and set up a stumping. No such luck, even though he does beat the batsman

sweep again and this one too is outside off - but the key here is Handscomb doesn't premeditate. He only reacts. He knows the ball is on a length. He knows he can get under it and hammer it away to the square leg boundary
another measured sweep to end the over, single to square leg
goes back to a length ball that sneaks through at ankle height on middle stump. Manages to clip it away into the leg side
again he's on the back foot, again there's hardly any bounce. Just outside off this time. Makes room too, to cut. Can only jab it into the covers with a straight bat
tossed up slow on leg stump, lovely use of the hands to reverse-paddle it into the fine third man region

slow flight once again, outside off. Dhoni sees him shape for the reverse-sweep and moves a couple of steps to his right. And that enables him to deflect the ball away into the point region, off his pad. Could have gone really fine, possibly for four, otherwise
length ball close to off stump, punched firmly back to the bowler

back of a length on off stump, makes room, and that's driven away brilliantly off the back foot, to the left of extra-cover. Didn't bounce much at all, but he watched it all the way and managed to swing freely through his shot
length ball, a bit of late swing in towards off stump. Shapes to drive through the off side initially. Checks his shot and it rolls to mid-on off the inside half of the bat
full on middle stump, and that's a super shot from Handscomb, who's really showing off his 50-overs chops here. A step forward, and then he uses his wrists to flick it up and over midwicket

what a glorious bit of fielding this is. Shami shortens his length slightly, gets it to tail back in slightly towards off stump. Handscomb presses half-forward, chops to the right of backward point, and calls his partner through for a quick single. Mistake, because who's the fielder at backward point? Ravindra Jadeja. He swoops onto the ball like lightning and hurls down the stumps at the non-striker's end with a fiercely powerful, flat no-bounce throw. What an incredible fielder he is. Handscomb was really hurrying, but no batsman is quicker than the ball
back of a length outside off, slapped to the sweeper at deep point
very full, almost in the blockhole, on middle stump. Gets his front pad out of the way and jabs into the covers
back of a length, drifts down leg. Can't connect with the tuck off the hip
length ball on middle and leg, and that's timed beautifully, clipped to the right of midwicket. Deep square leg has to run a long way to his right to stop that

flat, shortish, offers up some width, and Stoinis is really playing him well here. Steps back and across and slaps it between cover and extra-cover. Wrong line to bowl without a sweeper back on the fence
flat length ball outside off, ends up leaving the batsman off the pitch - just carries on with the angle of drift. Slapped to extra-cover
back of a length outside off, stabbed out to deep point
back of a length close to off stump, goes with the arm. Punched to short extra-cover
comes in with the arm again, cramps him for room as he goes back and across. Manages to punch it down the ground for a single to long-on

dangled up super slow outside off. Stoinis is in position to reverse-paddle about two days before the ball arrives, and even Dhoni is in place, anticipating as always. Middles it nicely and picks up two well behind backward point
length ball angling in towards off stump. Gets half-forward and clips to mid-on

shortish outside off, nice wristwork at the top of the bounce to play that to the right of backward point, but Jadeja moves so quickly and throws himself at the ball, saves a couple more runs for his team
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, punched back firmly to the bowler
ooh, big angle in from Bumrah. Stoinis looks to stay leg-side of the ball and punch into the covers, only manages a thick inside edge into his pads. Rolls away slowly, square on the off side
back of a length, nipping in towards middle and off and cramping Carey for room. Defended towards short extra-cover
short, a bit of width, but deep point is in place and all Carey gets for his nice-looking cut is a single
tossed up slow, turns from middle to off. Looks to sweep fine, but can only get some glove on it, and it rolls harmlessly for a few yards and stops
bit of an appeal for lbw as he presses forward to defend this googly, bat and pad close together. Looks like pad first, but they don't review - not sure if it struck him in line
wide stock ball, reaches out to stab it into the point region
tossed up slower and closer to off stump, swept away to deep square leg
back of a length close to off stump, makes room and cuts it straight to backward point
looped up on middle and leg, too full for the full-blooded sweep. Manages to drag it to deep backward square leg, off the bottom half of the bat
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, uses his wrists to whip it from off stump towards long leg
full outside off, Stoinis plays a checked drive to short extra-cover
length ball outside off, straightens off the seam to beat Stoinis' angled-bat drive. No footwork at all
back of a length close to off stump, keeps a touch low. Defended into the covers
back of a length, angles this one sharply in towards leg stump. Extra bounce too, and Stoinis, looking to hurriedly jump and flick, is hit on the thigh pad
length ball close to off stump, stays back and eases the ball to the right of extra-cover

shortish, spins away from off stump, rocks back and cuts it fiercely, behind square and a long way to the right of Vijay Shankar at sweeper cover. Big effort from the fielder there - a long sprint and a sprawling dive, but he can't quite keep it in
again a touch short, this time the cut goes straight to backward point
shot! Tossed up on off stump, and it's the stock ball. He clears his front leg and gets down low to slog-sweep it firmly, along the ground and against the turn, to the midwicket boundary
short again, the amount of turn he gets forces him to reach for the ball, however, and hit it straighter than he'd strictly like. Slapped to the fielder at sweeper cover
shot! Australia needed a big over, and they're getting it against Kuldeep Yadav. Sees some flight and jumps down the track to launch this high and far, with the turn, over long-on
tossed up full just outside off, too full to drive firmly, just about jabs it back to the bowler
shortish, cramps him with the angle in towards off stump. Chopped away to third man

back of a length, and some movement back in off the seam to beat Stoinis' inside edge as he looks to punch through mid-on/midwicket. Hits him on the back leg, and Shami goes up in appeal, but it's probably going over the top of the stumps, and definitely missing leg too
full, angling into middle and off, clipped to long-on
back of a length, again gets some late movement, this time towards off stump, to cramp Stoinis. Pokes it into the cover point region to pick up one
short, sits up outside off, may have been the slower one. Pulled to deep midwicket
low full-toss, tails in towards leg stump. Punched to long-on, shows the full face
and he starts with a short ball dragged down outside off stump. Stoinis is seeing them very well here, and he cracks it away to the point boundary
back of a length, turns in towards the hip, worked away to deep square leg

he's conceding runs, but with Kuldeep Yadav a wicket is always round the corner. Wrong'un, floated up wide of off stump. Too full to sweep, and Carey only manages to drag it onto his stumps off the bottom edge
flighted ball pitching on middle stump and sliding on with the angle. Props forward and defends into the off side
short outside off and Coulter-Nile slaps it up in the air, into the gap to the left of long-off

flighted ball on off stump, Coulter-Nile goes for the big heave with the turn, and he doesn't connect all too cleanly but lands the ball in the gap between long-on and deep midwicket. Kuldeep ends with figures of 3 for 54.
back of a length close to off stump, opens his bat face to steer towards third man

bowled him! Not the best shot from Coulter-Nile. He's been going after everything, and this is particularly risky, making room to try and cut Bumrah. That wicked angle does the rest, and there's no bat involved as the ball sneaks through and knocks back middle stump
full, angling in towards middle and leg. Keeps his pad out of the way and blocks it back to the bowler

lovely delivery, and there's a big appeal for a low catch behind. Dhoni thinks it's out. They're taking this upstairs, and the soft signal is out. Length ball angling into a fourth-stump line, and it straightens off the pitch. Cummins pokes at it, gets a thin edge, and Dhoni, falling forward and to his right, takes this low chance as cleanly as possible. Bumrah is turning it on here
back of a length, and again he angles it into the corridor and gets it to jag away off the seam. Lyon pushes at it and fails to put bat on ball

ooh, again he gets it to straighten, this time from a fuller length and an off-stump line. Lyon is half-forward, and again he pushes inside the line, but gets a vital thick edge that sends the ball rolling down to third man
full on off stump, clipped away to deep midwicket

back of a length close to off stump, stabbed to Jadhav at backward point. No run was available, and they weren't going for one, but Jadhav throws to the batsman's end anyway. Would have been okay if the midwicket fielder had backed up properly, but Rayudu fumbles and Stoinis gets back on strike
back of a length, nips back into off stump to cramp Stoinis for room. He simply blocks it back to the bowler

back of a length, and that's a super shot. Fifth-stump line, so not a particularly bad ball, but he waits, and uses his wrists brilliantly to open his bat face slightly and carve it to the left of the diving backward point fielder
back of a length, a little wider, chopped down to third man

in the blockhole on middle stump, some late swing in as well - he's been getting the old ball to do that right through - and Lyon juuust gets his bat down in time to flick to long leg. Stoinis refuses the single, he wants the strike

length ball angling in towards off stump, gets a nice stride in and defends it back down the pitch, solidly. Bumrah lets it run, willing Stoinis to take the single as mid-off ambles towards the ball. No way is Stoinis taking that single
back of a length close to off stump, defended to extra-cover. Stoinis is doing the Dhoni thing here, rightly. The asking rate isn't all that steep even now
in the blockhole, angling in towards off stump. Opens his bat face and squeezes it out to backward point
back of a length on off stump, blocked solidly into the off side

well, there's little he can do about this. The Bumrah special, angling into the corridor, pitching on a good length, straightening away, beating the outside edge as Stoinis presses forward, looking for a push into the off side

back of a length, angling into off stump. The one ball you might presume Bumrah might bowl. Stoinis shuffles across and nudges it away into the backward square leg region to retain strike. Once we know which way the result goes, this over could assume a lot of meaning in hindsight.
back of a length, angling into middle stump. Looks to make room to hit through the off side, can't find it. Punches it back to the bowler
back of a length, angling into middle and leg. Steps across this time, whips it in the air, juuust out of reach of Kuldeep diving to his left and backwards at square leg, brings up his fifty
length ball on off stump, shuffles across again to clip through square leg. Takes the single now, leaves Lyon three balls to keep out.
short outside off, makes a bit of room and slaps to deep point
sees Stoinis looking to manufacture room and bowls a back-of-a-length ball angling into leg stump and cramping him for room. Swiped down to long-on, not much power on it

full-toss, angling marginally down leg, and Lyon swings at it and gets a critical bit of bat on it. Fine leg was back, but he was too square, and this absolutely flies over the turf and gives him no chance

big appeal, and it's given! Immediate review too. Nowhere near short enough to pull, and not full enough to loft over mid-on, and he's caught between the two. It's angling in towards leg stump. Misses, and it hits him on the back leg. Looked out on first viewing, and it still looks out now. Let's see what ball-tracking has to say. No bat on it. Umpire's call on leg stump, and Stoinis has to walk back dejected. An excellent innings, he's kept Australia in it right up to now. And they still just need one big hit, even if it's Nos. 10 and 11 at the crease
length ball on off stump, makes room and jabs into the point region. Backward point dives right and gets a hand to it, but it rolls away from him and they can run a second

in the blockhole, and it's all over! He played a lovely innings at No. 5, and now he's bowled a great over under pressure. Full, straight, aiming at middle stump, and Zampa, making room to try and carve it away through point, fails to connect
